alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 4:01PM PST until December 27 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS AND MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES EXPECTED THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING... .A much colder airmass moving southward from interior Canada will combine with the continued widespread snow showers to bring accumulating snow to all of western Oregon and southwest Washington. This will include elevations all the way to the valley floors and to sea level on the coast. Today`s melted snow at lower elevations will likely freeze on roads by evening to create hazardous travel conditions. Snow will gradually decrease in coverage and intensity late tonight into Monday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches under heavier showers. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Central Oregon Coast. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Expect slippery road conditions with snow and ice covered roads in many areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall amounts could greatly vary spatially due to the showery nature of the snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
